name: Dr. Seventy-Five's Training Tower
description:
"Story" 

Dr. Seventy-Five, an engineer designed a tower used to train fighters. Can you beat it? 

Controls

Left Key- Move Left

Right Key- Move Right

Up Key- Move Up 

Down Key - Move Down 

Z Key- Punch

X Key- Shoot Lasers

Enter Key- Select

Escape Key- Return to Title Screen

Level Objective 

In order to beat each level, you must find the boss door. Once you enter, you must beat the boss. Doing so will allow you to use the elevator to go to the next level. There are three levels to beat.  Fight the machines to level up your stats, find all teddy bears in the level, and find keys that will let you pass through pathways that are block by key blocks.

Stats

HP- Your health. Losing all of it will make you lose one of your lives.

Energy- Energy needed to use your eye lasers.

Melee EXP- The experience gained using your punches. Anytime you hit an enemy, it goes up. Getting up to 100 points will increase the Melee Level, making the damage your punches do higher. Getting a game over will not only lose all the EXP gained in the specific level, but any levels and stats boosts gained will return back to what it was previously.

Projectile EXP- The experience gained using your eye lasers. Anytime you hit an enemy, it goes up. Getting up to 100 points will increase the Projectile Level, making the damage your lasers do higher.  Getting a game over will not only lose all the EXP gained in the specific level, but any levels and stats boosts gained will return back to what it was previously.

Fight EXP- The experience gained after defeating an enemy. Enemy can give different amount of experience. Getting up to 100 points will increase the Fight Level, making your HP and Energy go up.  Getting a game over will not only lose all the EXP gained in the specific level, but any levels and stats boosts gained will return back to what it was previously.

Keys- The number of keys you collected which are needed to open key blocks that block pathways. Even if you lose one of your lives, you will still have all of your keys unless you get a game over. 

Bears- Teddy bears you collected in the level. Dr. Seventy-Five's assistant places three bears in each level. If you lose one of your lives, all teddy bears gained from the level will reset to 0, unless you made it to a boss room. It will also reset if you get a game over.  Remember, you will not be able to come back and get any remaining bears if you enter the boss room. 

Life- Your lives. Losing all lives will get you a game over, resetting your efforts made in the level.  If you load back a file, lives reset back to three. 

Bears Saved- In order to keep the bears, you will have to beat the level. Saving all three bears will reward you three lives. Thank the assistant for that. 

Free Hint

There's a pink jellyfish-like enemy in Level 3.  It is immune to all of your attacks. Touching it takes all of your HP away. It can also move through most walls.
